Background.text:
Infections spread by mosquitos, ticks, flies.
Dengue fever is the most common causes of arboviral disease around the world.
Increased incidence in warmer months.

Clinical_Features.text:
Most commonly manifest as four syndromes (that may overlap:)
Fever and myalgia
Arthritis and rash
Encephalitis
Viral hemorrhagic fever
Headache common part of all syndromes

Differential_Diagnosis.text:
Fever and rash
Encephalitis
Viral hemorrhagic fever

Evaluation.text:
Detailed travel and exposure history
Local epidemiologic patterns helpful
Specific serologic testing

Management.text:
Symptomatic management
Exclude other causes if serious presentation
Consider empiric
acyclovir
and
antibiotics
until
HSV
and
bacterial meningitis
/encephalitis ruled out.

References.text: Takhar SS, Moran GJ. Disseminated Viral Infections. In: Tintinalli JE, Stapczynski J, Ma O, Cline DM, Cydulka RK, Meckler GD, T. eds. Tintinalli's Emergency Medicine: A Comprehensive Study Guide. New York, NY: McGraw-Hill; 2011.
